definition: to offer sacrifice (to one's ancestors)
surname Zhai
to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield
to pay respect/worship/visit/salute

sentences.english: On the day, people offered sacrifices and expressed their thoughts and feelings under the full, bright moon.
sentences.chinese: 中秋当日，人们对着天上皓月观赏祭拜，寄托情怀。

sentences.english: Dried tangerine or orange peel to visit wench, swear will help her revenge, kill Zhang Qishan.
sentences.chinese: 陈皮去祭拜丫头，发誓一定会帮她报仇，杀死张启山。

sentences.english: It was believed to be especially appropriate for people with feelings at variance with the official norms.
sentences.chinese: 人们相信它更适合祭拜，即使这跟官方法律相悖。

sentences.english: The ancient Maya worshiped the God of Death.
He is a very special god worshiped by kiln workers.
sentences.chinese: 他可是窑工们祭拜的一位非常特殊的神。

sentences.english: Return home today to worship grandfather.
sentences.chinese: 今天要回老家祭拜外公。

sentences.english: This is a day to worship the moon god.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个天祭拜月亮神。

sentences.english: Today, Mount Putuo is the largest oblation place for Kwan-yin Bodhisattva.
sentences.chinese: 直至今日，普陀山已是最有名的祭拜观音的圣地。

sentences.english: People with the same surname or family clan gather at their ancestral temples to worship their ancestors in order of their ages.
sentences.chinese: 同宗同族的人们齐聚在先祖祠堂，按年龄祭拜祖先。

sentences.english: Ancient people believed that a place on top of the wall was most ideal for worshiping Kuixing.
sentences.chinese: 古代人认为在这个位置祭拜魁星效果最好。

sentences.english: The ancestors worship of the gods.
Yuzuki, that is, worship goddess of the moon.
Set a spirit tablet to mourn a just losted rmb100 bank note.
sentences.chinese: 设一个灵位祭拜一下刚刚丢失的100元人民币。

definition: to worship/to observe religious rites/to pay one's respects (to one's ancestors etc)
to offer sacrifices to one's ancestors
to offer sacrifices (to one's ancestors)/to hold or attend a memorial service
offering
sacrificial offerings/worship/religious rite
to formally call on/to worship (a God)/to pay homage to sb
memorial tablet
memorial tablet
to burn incense
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to pay homage (at a monument, mausoleum etc)
to offer sacrifices to the gods or ancestors
to consecrate/to enshrine and worship/an offering (to one's ancestors)/a sacrifice (to a God)
to worship piously/to present/to dedicate
to worship/to make customary deferences to/a pilgrimage
to pray for blessings
to burn incense at a temple
